occurrences.text: Bible says that when Israel was strong, that they put the Canaanites to tribute. In fact, you'll find various interactions throughout the the Old Testament with regard to this people group, the Canaanites as they're referred to as, but you find that when Israel was strong, they would put them to tribute, they would be a servant of servants. In 1 Kings chapter number 9, we'll finish up with this particular passage of Scripture dealing with this first aspect of the prophecy of Noah. In 1 Kings chapter number 9, in verses 20 and 21. In 1 Kings 9, now think about this, the amount of time that has passed, we go all the way now to the time of Solomon, and it tells us in the beginning of the passage in verse number 1, and it came to pass when Solomon had finished the building of the house of the Lord, and the king's house, and all Solomon's desire, which he was pleased to do. Now, that's a long period of time from Genesis chapter number 9, and this prophecy of Noah. We see the entrance into the land, and the way in which the Canaanites became servants, and they were under tribute, and we've read all of those things, and we now fast forward through the period of the judges, and we get through the period of course of Saul reigning as king, and David reigning as king, and now we find that Solomon is
